area_name: River Boulder aka The Shield, The

content.description:
I believe this route is technically a harder variation to the Irregular Arete. Start low on the upstream end of the River Boulder on the two jugs on either side of the bulge. Get low and difficult to see feet, or a heel/toe hook around the right edge. Manage your way up the bulge with a couple powerful throws and slaps up the arete feature to your right. 

This problem is an eliminate and does not use the face to the left of the bulge and stays on the bulge itself the entire time. If you use the face then you climbed the original problem, Irregular Arete V1.
content.protection: The low crux can be protected easily with one pad but it would have been nice to have another and a spotter for the top out.
content.location: To get to the river boulder, take the first left in the park, park right away. Hike up the street until you get to a trail on the right. Walk down the stairs and follow the trail down river until you see an obvious boulder on the right about 100 feet down the trail.   The problem is on the upriver (east?) side of the River Boulder and follows the bulge straight up.

content.description: One of the first "established" boulder problems in Palisades State Park. Start out by smearing on tiny pinky sized nub on the bottom. With your left hand grab the side crimp to the left. Your right had crimps the right side crimper. Once you get that down pull yourself up all well keeping your body weight on the right leg and balanced. Reach with your right hand up to another small crimper and then bring your left hand up above to a crimper on the left smear and pull up and over. Super Classy and Super Fun!
content.location: Right by the River. Climb side facing river.

content.description: Sit start on two low holds on the upriver side of the boulder, up the block to the apex. Knee-bars might come in handy.
content.protection: Pad, quite low start might be hard with a thick pad.

pathTokens: River Boulder aka The Shield, The

content.description: The River boulder was one of the first "established" boulders in Palisades. It is in a perfect location right by the river on the shaded side. If this boulder was a few feet taller it would be classic anywhere. A great crimp slab problem and a couple of harder SDS on the arete problems exist.
